description: The students of class 3-E have a mission: kill their teacher before graduation. He has already destroyed the moon, and has promised to destroy the Earth if he can not be killed within a year. But how can this class of misfits kill a tentacled monster, capable of reaching Mach 20 speed, who may be the best teacher any of them have ever had?

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tentacles
tags.description: Features the long appendages most commonly associated with octopuses or squid, often sexually penetrating a character.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

name.native: イリーナ・イェラビッチ

node.description: A manga artist known for creating Assassination Classroom and Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro. He was an assistant of Yoshio Sawai, the creator of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo (Neuro's Shirota Masakage made a cameo appearance in Shinsetsu Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo). He provided the voice of the mangaka in episode 25 of the Majin Tantei Nougami Neuro anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
One of [Lerche](https://anilist.co/studio/456/)'s leading animators.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
Freelance sound effects creator.

__Height:__ 158cm

[Profile (m&i)](http://mand-i.jp/talent/fuchigami-mai/) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/fuchigamimai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fuchigami_mai)

name.native: フレデリック・フランソワ・ショパン

node.description: Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin, also known as Frédéric François Chopin, was a Polish composer, virtuoso pianist, and music teacher, of French-Polish parentage. He was one of the great masters of Romantic music.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naokisato_face) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1hlpldRj6GZ2naD4XDqi80)

Naoki Sato is a Japanese composer and producer who has provided the music for several popular anime series. He was born on May 2, 1970 and graduated in Chiba Prefecture and Tokyo College of Music. At the 29th Japanese Academy Awards in 2006, he won the Best Music prize for his work on the film Always Sanchōme no Yuhi.

moumoon is a Japanese pop duo consisting of two members: vocalist and lyricist Yuka and composer Kousuke Masaki. Formed in 2005, the duo signed with Gate Records in 2006, and released their debut single "Flowers/Pride", and mini-album Flowers that September. In 2007, they left Gate Records and signed with Avex Trax, releasing their second mini-album, Love Me? in August. The duo's name is a combination of the French "Mou" and the English "Moon", together meaning "Soft Moon"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BamFdz)

Iván Jair Fernández Isidoro is a Mexican voice actor.

An italian actor, voice actor, ADR director and dialogue writer, mostly known for his roles as [Piccolo Jr.](https://anilist.co/character/914/) and [All For One](https://anilist.co/character/125956/).

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/fabioreallyfast/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FabioCamposDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fabio.campos.3511)

Fábio Campos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director and musician.

As dubbing director, he has worked at DuBrasil since 2014, and is also a professor in the studio's dubbing course. He also works as a musician, being a bassist in the group Speed ​​Bullets Trio.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Takeda Takahashi (Mortal Kombat X)
- José Manuel Esquivel "Chema" (Grachi)
- Marlon (The Walking Dead: The Final Season)
- Saber (Mobile Legends: Bang Bang)
- Agent Ned Ross (NCIS: Hawai'i)
- Peter Porker / Spider-Ham and Two-Gun Kid (LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2)
- El Chavo del Ocho (El Chavo video game)
- Joshua "Josh" Wilson / White Josh (Crazy Ex-Girlfriend)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jmichaeltatum)

Married to fellow voice actor [Brandon McInnis](https://anilist.co/staff/127809/).

[Website](http://apphiayu.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/soymilkpudding)

Apphia Yu, also known as Ayu Sakata, is an American voice actress, director, and producer. She has worked on games such as Loren The Amazon Princess and Tales of Aravorn: Seasons of the Wolf, or for anime like Assassination Classroom. She is the founder of sakevisual, a company based in Dallas, Texas that makes original visual novel games. She is married to voice actor [Micah Solusod](https://anilist.co/staff/103686/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
